articles.headline: Rebuilding Its Economy, Iraq Shuns U.S. Businesses
articles.snippet: Baghdad’s first trade fair since the invasion six years ago attracted 396 companies, but only a few from the United States.
articles.abstract: Baghdad’s first trade fair since the invasion six years ago attracted 396 companies, but only a few from the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD  Iraq’s Baghdad Trade Fair ended Tuesday, six years and a trillion dollars after the American invasion that toppled Saddam Hussein, and one country was conspicuously absent.

articles.headline: A Lack of Rigor Costs MBIA
articles.snippet: The bond insurer’s standing has suffered as lax due diligence has come to light in suits it has filed against Wall Street firms.
articles.abstract: The bond insurer’s standing has suffered as lax due diligence has come to light in suits it has filed against Wall Street firms.
articles.lead_paragraph: MBIA, the financial insurance company, used to hold itself out as a paragon of hard work and number crunching.

articles.headline: After Bankruptcy, G.M. Struggles to Shed a Legendary Bureaucracy
articles.snippet: G.M. will present its first postbankruptcy scorecard on Monday, when it reports third-quarter earnings and its cash reserves.
articles.abstract: G.M. will present its first postbankruptcy scorecard on Monday, when it reports third-quarter earnings and its cash reserves.

articles.headline: For Comcast’s Chief, Content Led the Way
articles.snippet: At a dinner 12 years ago in Redmond, Wash., Brian L. Roberts challenged the richest man in the world to invest in his business  cable TV.
articles.abstract: At a dinner 12 years ago in Redmond, Wash., Brian L. Roberts challenged the richest man in the world to invest in his business  cable TV.
articles.lead_paragraph: At a dinner 12 years ago in Redmond, Wash., Brian L. Roberts challenged the richest man in the world to invest in his business  cable TV.
articles.byline: By Tim Arango and Brian Stelter

articles.headline: A New Cholesterol Study Puts Focus on Merck Drugs
articles.snippet: Researchers will present results with potentially significant implications for multibillion-dollar cholesterol medications from Merck.
articles.abstract: Researchers will present results with potentially significant implications for multibillion-dollar cholesterol medications from Merck.
articles.lead_paragraph: Some of Wall Street’s leading drug industry analysts are scheduled to fly to Orlando, Fla., on Sunday afternoon. A junket to SeaWorld it is not.

articles.headline: Scarred, Fort Hood Survivors Move On
articles.snippet: Those who lived through the violence at Fort Hood are struggling to live with scars and limps and frayed nerves.
articles.abstract: Those who lived through the violence at Fort Hood are struggling to live with scars and limps and frayed nerves.
articles.lead_paragraph: KILLEEN, Tex.  It seemed unlikely that Christopher Royal was going to be delivering the sermon Sunday at Shiloh Baptist Church in the tiny town of Eclectic, Ala., as scheduled. Mr. Royal, a chief warrant officer in the Army, had been shot three times in the back during the rampage at Fort Hood.
articles.byline: By Campbell Robertson and Serge F. Kovaleski

articles.headline: Afghan Enclave Seen as Model for Development
articles.snippet: To avoid official corruption, the people in the Jurm Valley use village councils and direct grants.
articles.abstract: To avoid official corruption, the people in the Jurm Valley use village councils and direct grants.
articles.lead_paragraph: JURM, Afghanistan  Small grants given directly to villagers have brought about modest but important changes in this corner of Afghanistan, offering a model in a country where official corruption and a Taliban insurgency have frustrated many large-scale development efforts.

articles.headline: Accused 9/11 Mastermind to Face Civilian Trial in N.Y.
articles.snippet: Khalid Shaikh Mohammed and four other men accused in the plot will be prosecuted in federal court, but other detainees will face military trials, the attorney general said.
articles.abstract: Khalid Shaikh Mohammed and four other men accused in the plot will be prosecuted in federal court, but other detainees will face military trials, the attorney general said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said Friday that it would prosecute Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, the self-described mastermind of the Sept. 11 attacks, in a Manhattan federal courtroom, a decision that ignited a sharp political debate but took a step toward resolving one of the most pressing terrorism detention issues.

articles.headline: Two Are Charged With Helping Madoff Falsify Records
articles.snippet: The F.B.I. arrested two computer programmers who worked for Bernard L. Madoff’s investment firm, prosecutors said on Friday.
articles.abstract: The F.B.I. arrested two computer programmers who worked for Bernard L. Madoff’s investment firm, prosecutors said on Friday.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two computer programmers who worked for Bernard L. Madoff’s brokerage firm were arrested on Friday and accused of helping him sustain his long-running Ponzi scheme.
